Strike of unionists in South Korea
articles.content:
Strike of unionists in South Korea 
    Pyongyang, May 28 (KCNA) -- Over 9,000 unionists of the federation of taxi trade union under the (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) went on strike all at once at 106 working sites in Seoul, Inchon, Kwangju and all other parts of South Korea on May 24, according to the South Korean newspaper Hangyore.
 The organization declared that it would wage a death-defying struggle by all means and ways including large-scale car demonstrations and control of highway in ten cities even during the world cup championships unless the management side has sincere negotiations.    
 Over 2,100 taxi drivers stopped running in Inchon and over 350 in Kwangju on the same day.

articles.content:
North side committee of grand festival for national reunification 
    Pyongyang, May 28 (KCNA) -- The north side's preparatory committee for a grand festival for national reunification marking the second anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration was organized in Pyongyang on May 27.
 The north side's preparatory committee consists of 11 personages with chairman Kim Yong Dae of the national reconciliation council as its chairman.
